Html:
Hi,

I am new to symfony. I downloaded the Plugin\

symfony plugin-install http://plugins.symfony-project.com/sfPhpExcelPlugin

But when I execute the
php plugins/sfPhpExcelPlugin/examples/01simple.php

I get the following error

C:\Program Files\xampp\htdocs\wbrt>php plugins/sfPhpExcelPlugin/examples/01simpl
e.php
09:20:58 Create new PHPExcel object

Fatal error: Class 'sfPhpExcel' not found in C:\Program Files\xampp\htdocs\wbrt\
plugins\sfPhpExcelPlugin\examples\01simple.php on line 33.


I have read that we have to store the class files in lib directories and do symfony cc for class autoloading

http://www.symfony-project.org/book/1_2/19-Mastering-Symfony-s-Configuration-Files

Please help me in this regard.

Regards

Deepak Bhatia

Hi,

This problem is solved but

$objWriter = new PHPExcel_Writer_Excel2007($objPHPExcel);
$objWriter->save(str_replace('.php', '.xlsx', __FILE__));

The above lines are throwing the exception.

Regards

Deepak Bhatia
Can you paste what you get for the exception?

Hi,
Thanks for your reply.
My PHP Application runs on linux and I am getting the excel file creation exception probably because of write permissions on linux from PHP Code.
The same PHP code works on the Windows machine and I am getting the excel file.
Regards
Deepak Bhatia

From: koyama

Can you paste what you get for the exception?

Hi,

I  downloaded the  plugin.But I got the following error message.

This is path:

 $path = '/plugins/Classes/PHPExcel/';
 set_include_path(get_include_path() . PATH_SEPARATOR . $path);

Fatal error: Class 'sfPhpExcel' not found in /home/padmagc/sfprojects2/timsCore/apps/backend/modules/rpttrekkerdistribution/actions/actions.class.php on line 178

 

What and where should I need to change?

I donot have an idea how to implement in  symfony .

Please let me know

 

Kind Regards

Padma

Did you do php symfony cc in your project directory ?

Hi:

I'm having the same error while trying to create a Excel 2003 file. Take a look at my code:

public function executeExcel2003creator(sfWebRequest $request) {
    $excel = new sfPhpExcel();
    $excel->getProperties()->setCreator('AfilReg');
    $excel->getProperties()->setTitle($this->getResponse()->getTitle());
    $excel->getActiveSheet()->getDefaultStyle()->getFont()->setName('Arial');
    $excel->getActiveSheet()->getDefaultStyle()->getFont()->setSize(10);
    $excel->setActiveSheetIndex(0);
    $excel->getActiveSheet()->setCellValue('A1','No. Identidad');
    $excel->getActiveSheet()->setCellValue('B1','Sexo');
    $excel->getActiveSheet()->setCellValue('C1','Fecha de Ingreso');
    $excel->getActiveSheet()->setCellValue('D1','Empresa');
    $excel->getActiveSheet()->setCellValue('E1','Título');

$excel->getActiveSheet()->setTitle($this->getResponse()->getTitle());
    
    $excel->setActiveSheetIndex(0);
    // Save Excel 2007 file
    $objWriter = PHPExcel_IOFactory::createWriter($excel, 'Excel2003');
    $objWriter->save(str_replace('.php', '.xls', __FILE__));
  }

The error is the same:

Fatal error: Class 'sfPhpExcel' not found in D:\WebServer\varwww\dev\afilreg\apps\frontend\modules\reportes\actions\actions.class.php on line 42

And yes, I cleanup the cache (symfony cc), can any help me?

Did you put this in plugins directory ?

Just enable the plugin
 
class ProjectConfiguration extends sfProjectConfiguration {
  public function setup() {
    $this->enablePlugins(array(
            'sfDoctrinePlugin',
            'sfDoctrineGuardPlugin',
            'sfPhpExcelPlugin'
    ));
  }
}

Cheers and glad to help
 
Anyway, I have another question: How I save the generated files to /web/uploads dir? By default the library save the files to actions/ folder wich seem bad to me.
